Class Processor

    Runnable

    public class Processor
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Processes the data that a Reciever recieved
    Author:
    Andrew Huber

      • Processor

        public Processor(Buffer b2,
         int t,
         int n)
        Creates an object that will process the data that a Reciever recieved
        Parameters:
        b2 - the second buffer, B2, as specified in the project document
        t - the value T as specified in the project document
        n - the value N as specified in the project document

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts processing the data from the buffer. It performs the following steps:
        1. Sorts the data using merge sort or insertion sort (depending on the value of T)
        2. Normalizes the sorted data
        3. Generates a grayscale image using the normalized data
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • mergesort

        private void mergesort(int min,
             int max)
        Performs merge sort on data between min and max
        Parameters:
        min - an index number serving as the lower bounds
        max - an index number serving as the upper bounds

      • insertionsort

        private void insertionsort(int min,
                 int max)
        Performs insertion sort on data between min and
        Parameters:
        min - an index number serving as the lower bounds
        max - an index number serving as the upper bounds

      • normalize

        private void normalize()
        Performs the data normalization. This algorithm is based on what I learned from this video

      • time

        Returns the amount of time it took to sort the data in seconds

        the amount of time it took to sort the data in seconds
